text: William Alvin "Tex" Moncrief Jr."The 400 Richest Americans - #374 William Alvin Moncrief Jr", Forbes.com, 21 September 2006 [accessed 31 March 2014]Moncrief Oil International Pledges Gift That Could Total $500 Million for University" , The University of Texas at Austin, official website, 30 September 2008 [accessed 31 March 2014] (March 27, 1920 - December 29, 2021) was an American businessman and philanthropist. He worked in the oil and gas sector."The World's Billionaires: #1587 William Moncrief, Jr." - Forbes.com [accessed 31 March 2014]Carroll, J. (2010) "Texas Wildcatter Moncrief Hits Latest Gusher Beneath Old Fields" - Bloomberg.com, 20 January 2010 [accessed 31 March 2014] He was President of Moncrief Oil, and was a billionaire member of the 2006 Forbes 400, with an estimated net worth of US$1 billion. Moncrief died on December 29, 2021 in Fort Worth, Texas at the age of 101.Fort Worth philanthropist and legendary oilman William ‘Tex’ Moncrief dies at 101 ==References== ==Other websites== *William Moncrief ranked #374 on 2006 Forbes 400 *Brief interview with Forbes Category:1920 births Category:2021 deaths Category:American billionaires Category:American centenarians Category:Businesspeople from Fort Worth, Texas Category:Philanthropists from Texas
